programme.title: The Saint (1997)
programme.desc: Master-of-disguises Simon Templar (Val Kilmer) falls for a U.S. scientist (Elisabeth Shue) whose cold-fusion formula he must steal.

programme.title: The Core (2003)
programme.desc: In order to save mankind, scientists and astronauts must set off a nuclear device at the center of the Earth.

programme.title: Get Shorty (1995)
programme.desc: A film-loving loan shark (John Travolta) teams with a B-movie producer (Gene Hackman) to become a Hollywood mogul.

programme.title: The Hillside Strangler
programme.sub-title: City of Dreams, City of Nightmares
programme.desc: Ten women are slain, their bodies dumped across the iconic hillsides of Los Angeles; activists demand justice as the media turns murder into spectacle; detectives Frank Salerno and Pete Finnigan race to stop the killer before he strikes again.

programme.title: The Hillside Strangler
programme.sub-title: The Many Faces of Ken Bianchi
programme.desc: Detectives link two killings in Bellingham, WA, to Ken Bianchi, exposing him as the Hillside Strangler; facing death row, he claims amnesia and submits to hypnosis; decades later, Bianchi argues his murderous confessions were fabricated.

programme.title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back (2001)
programme.sub-title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back (2001)
programme.desc: Two slackers venture to Hollywood to sabotage the production of a new movie based on their alter egos.

programme.title: Death Wish II (1982)
programme.desc: The architect (Charles Bronson) from New York turns vigilante in Los Angeles after more brutality too close to home.

programme.title: Death Wish 3 (1985)
programme.desc: The vigilante architect (Charles Bronson) shops by mail for what he needs to waste punks in the streets of New York.

programme.title: Tank Girl (1995)
programme.desc: A renegade (Lori Petty) challenges the controller (Malcolm McDowell) of the worlds water supply on a post-apocalyptic desert Earth.

programme.title: Forces of Nature (1999)
programme.desc: A bridegroom (Ben Affleck) hurries by plane to his wedding, but he and his seatmate (Sandra Bullock) must find other modes of travel.

programme.title: Unseen (2023)
programme.desc: Sam, a gas station clerk, receives a random call from Emily, a nearly blind woman whos running from her murderous ex in the woods. Using a phone, Sam becomes Emilys only chance for survival as she guides the terrified woman through a video call.

programme.title: Barbarella (1968)
programme.desc: Barbarella (Jane Fonda) roams 41st-century space with her blind guardian angel, Pygar (John Phillip Law).

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines (1997)
programme.desc: A former Marine (Thomas Ian Griffith) returns to Vietnam to rescue a comrade (Chris Mulkey) and retrieve nuclear triggers.

programme.title: The Purple Rose of Cairo (1985)
programme.desc: A 1930s movie star (Jeff Daniels) steps off the screen to join a waitress (Mia Farrow) in the audience.

programme.title: Whats the Worst That Could Happen? (2001)
programme.sub-title: Whats the Worst That Could Happen? (2001)
programme.desc: When a professional thief robs a beachfront mansion, he catches the owner in a compromising situation.

programme.title: Married to the Mob (1988)
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Matthew Modine) gets close to a gangsters widow (Michelle Pfeiffer) in order to nab a crime boss (Dean Stockwell).

programme.title: Easy Money (1983)
programme.desc: Photographer Monty (Rodney Dangerfield) will be rich from his late mother-in-laws (Geraldine Fitzgerald) estate if he can curb his vices for a year.

programme.title: Swingers (1996)
programme.desc: Would-be sultans of coolness help a socially inept friend find romance as they strut through Hollywood and Las Vegas.

programme.title: Barbershop (2002)
programme.desc: The owner of a popular barbershop considers selling the place to a loan shark who wants to convert it into a strip club.

programme.title: Barbershop 2: Back in Business (2004)
programme.desc: The owner of a barbershop faces pressure from a corporation that is opening establishments in his neighborhood.

programme.title: The Fighting Temptations (2003)
programme.desc: To collect his aunts inheritance, an unemployed man (Cuba Gooding Jr.) must form a gospel choir and lead it to success.

programme.title: A House on the Bayou (2021)
programme.desc: Hoping for an idyllic getaway, a couple and their daughter visit a remote mansion in rural Louisiana. When suspiciously friendly neighbors show up uninvited, the weekend soon takes a sinister turn as dark secrets test the familys fragile bond.

programme.title: The Hillside Strangler
programme.sub-title: The Many Faces of Ken Bianchi
programme.desc: Detectives link two killings in Bellingham, WA, to Ken Bianchi, exposing him as the Hillside Strangler; facing death row, he claims amnesia and submits to hypnosis; decades later, Bianchi argues his murderous confessions were fabricated.

programme.title: Unprotected Sets
programme.desc: With a biting wit and brutal honesty, Kelsey Cook covers the gamut, from Brazilian waxing to career advice from her parents; rising comedian Kiry Shabazz theorizes about how a doctors note is much more valuable than the constitution.

programme.title: Navy SEALS (1990)
programme.desc: Sea/air/land commandos (Charlie Sheen, Michael Biehn) and a TV newswoman (Joanne Whalley-Kilmer) rescue hostages from terrorists armed with Stinger missiles.

programme.title: The Pink Panther (1963)
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Jacques Clouseau (Peter Sellers) chases a jewel thief (David Niven) and his nephew (Robert Wagner).

programme.title: Agent Cody Banks (2003)
programme.desc: Recruited by the CIA, a teen works under cover to befriend a girl whose father unknowingly works for an evil organization.

programme.title: French Girl (2024)
programme.desc: When his girlfriend gets swept away to Canada by a job offer from her ex, a hopeless romantic travels to her hometown, only to find himself out of his depth while trying to charm her hard-to-impress, French-speaking family.

programme.title: RoboCop 3 (1993)
programme.desc: The cyborg policeman (Robert John Burke) takes to the air to defend a run-down neighborhood from a Japanese tycoon.

programme.title: The Generals Daughter (1999)
programme.desc: Two investigators (John Travolta, Madeleine Stowe) find an underworld of sex and cover-ups behind an Army captains murder.

programme.title: Weekend in Taipei (2024)
programme.desc: A former DEA agent and an ex-undercover operative rekindle their romance during a weekend in Taipei. As they reconnect, theyre oblivious to the looming dangers stemming from their past operations.

programme.title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners (2023)
programme.sub-title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners (2023)
programme.desc: Hoping to leave his dark past behind him, former assassin Finbar Murphy leads a quiet life in a coastal Irish town. However, when terrorists show up, he must soon choose between exposing his secret identity and defending his friends and neighbors.

programme.title: The Mexican (2001)
programme.desc: A bungling gangster (Brad Pitt) must reform to please his girlfriend (Julia Roberts) but still has one last job to fulfill.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
programme.desc: Branded a traitor, an elite intelligence agent (Tom Cruise) investigates a failed Prague mission to retrieve a computer disk.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II (2000)
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt is sent to Sydney to find and destroy a genetically modified disease called Chimera.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III (2006)
programme.desc: Now a trainer for IMF recruits, agent Ethan Hunt squares off against the toughest foe he has ever faced, a ruthless arms and information broker.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Ghost Protocol (2011)
programme.desc: The IMF is shut down when its implicated in the bombing of the Kremlin, causing Ethan Hunt and his new team to go rogue to clear their organizations name.

programme.title: Paid in Full (2002)
programme.desc: A dry cleaners delivery boy becomes one of the most powerful drug dealers in 1980s Harlem. Based on a true story.

programme.title: The Last Castle (2001)
programme.desc: A court-martialed general (Robert Redford) leads a revolt against a corrupt warden (James Gandolfini) in a military prison.

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: A law-school grad uncovers a sinister secret about the Tennessee firm that made him an offer he couldnt refuse.

programme.title: Dreamland (2019)
programme.desc: A teen bounty hunter is torn between helping or capturing a seductive fugitive bank robber hiding in his small town during the Great Depression.

programme.title: The Girl in the Pool (2024)
programme.desc: A mans life collapses when his mistress is found dead in his pool. Terrified of the consequences and desperate to protect his family, he conceals the truth, triggering a chaotic night that threatens to unravel his perfect life.

programme.title: Anthropoid (2016)
programme.desc: In December 1941, two Czech soldiers (Cillian Murphy, Jamie Dornan) parachute into their occupied homeland to assassinate Nazi officer Reinhard Heydrich (Detlef Bothe).

programme.title: Wander (2020)
programme.desc: Hired to investigate a suspicious death in the town of Wander, a paranoid private eye with a troubled past becomes convinced the case is linked to the same conspiracy and cover-up that caused the death of his daughter.

programme.title: Road to Perdition (2002)
programme.desc: Accompanied by his eldest son, a Depression-era mob enforcer (Tom Hanks) seeks revenge after the rest of his family are murdered by his employers (Paul Newman) jealous son.

programme.title: Event Horizon (1997)
programme.desc: A spaceship missing for seven years finally re-emerges and sends out a distress signal. But when a team is sent out to investigate, they discover that something sinister has taken over the craft.

programme.title: The Martian (2015)
programme.desc: Left behind by his crew, a stranded astronaut must find a way to survive on Mars, while NASA and a team of international scientists work tirelessly to bring him home.

programme.title: No Country for Old Men (2007)
programme.desc: An aging lawman (Tommy Lee Jones) reflects on his past and laments a changing world while trying to find and protect a hunter who took the cash from a drug deal gone bad.

programme.title: Switchback (1997)
programme.desc: A college student (Jared Leto) and a former rail worker (Danny Glover) are suspects in an FBI agents (Dennis Quaid) hunt for a serial killer who abducted his son.

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: A law-school grad uncovers a sinister secret about the Tennessee firm that made him an offer he couldnt refuse.

programme.title: Fighting (2009)
programme.desc: A scam artist (Terrence Howard) introduces a young man (Channing Tatum) to New Yorks bare-knuckle street-fighting circuit.

programme.title: Camp X-Ray (2014)
programme.desc: A female guard (Kristen Stewart) at Guantanamo Bay forms an unlikely friendship with one of the facilitys longtime detainees.

programme.title: Patriots Day (2016)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombings, police Sgt. Tommy Saunders, FBI Special Agent Richard DesLauriers and Commissioner Ed Davis join survivors, first responders and other investigators in a race against time to find the suspects.

programme.title: Silence (2016)
programme.desc: Two 17th-century Portuguese missionaries (Andrew Garfield, Adam Driver) face the ultimate test of faith when they travel to Japan to find their missing mentor (Liam Neeson).

programme.title: Gangs of New York (2002)
programme.desc: During the era of Tammany Halls sway, a young man (Leonardo DiCaprio) vows vengeance on the vicious gangster (Daniel Day-Lewis) who killed his father.

programme.title: Inside Angling
programme.desc: Massive tarpon and Cubera snappers are targeted in the estuary and offshore at the amazing Kwanza River in central Angola. We hunt these predators using lures and bait and come away with some amazing experiences.

programme.title: Wild Fly
programme.desc: Join the Wildfly Team as we explore the Brown Trout waters of the Highest Kingdom in the world. Battling the elements and scaling the Maletsunyane gorge, Gareth gets a taste of what this incredible river is renowned for.

programme.title: Wild Fish Wild Places
programme.desc: Denis and Austin go to Fort Peck Montana and catch some monster Walleye and Trout.

programme.title: Fishing the Wild With Mike Robinson
programme.desc: Mike and Joe go spearfishing and foraging for a scallop sandwich breakfast as well as lobsters and sea bass in South Devon.

programme.title: Hooked on Africa
programme.desc: Few anglers are privileged enough to track down their prey in virgin untouched waters. We join Madagascar Fishing Adventures at their base on Sakatia Island for the experience of a lifetime in the magical outer reaches of this unique wilderness.
